result.execSummary:
All charges against Willie James McElroy III in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Willie James McElroy III is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Willie James McElroy III

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Willie James McElroy III not in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Bastien appeared by video for Willie James McElroy III.  Prosecuting attorney Ryan Jay Michaels in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for jury trial.  State's essential witness failed to appear.  State has no alternative theory of prosecution.  Defense motion to DISMISS is granted by the Court WITHOUT PREJUDICE.
Case in court for motion hearing. Court placed on the record, findings of fact and legal analysis. For reasons stated on the record, the Court GRANTED the state's motion for joinder.

Defendant Willie James McElroy III not in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph P Bastien V appeared by video for Willie James McElroy III.  Prosecuting attorney Ryan Jay Michaels appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Final pre-trial held. Case remains in trial posture. Case remains calendared for a jury trial on 09/19/2022 at 8:30 am in Branch 29.
for joinder, filed.

Attorney Joseph P Bastien in court, defendant Willie James McElroy not in court, in custody.  Tristan J. Bednarek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a final pre-trial. State requests an adjourned final pre-trial.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Motions in Limine, received and filed.
Defendant's Proposed Jury Instructions, received and filed.
State's Motions in Limine, received and filed.
State's Witness List, received and filed.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. Expires: 10/11/22

Attorney Joseph P Bastien in court, defendant Willie James McElroy not in court, in custody.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a bail/bond hearing. Defense counsel withdraws their request for a bail motion.  Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed 48 hours before the final pretrial date. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 29.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR. 29:
Defendant Willie James McElroy in court with Attorney Joseph P Bastien; both appear by video.  Defendant Willie James McElroy in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29.  
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 29. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire & Waiver, filed.
Signed and filed, No Contact/No Firearms Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Monique L.A. and Melinda M.M.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION. If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to remain in custody until a device becomes available. ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  As a condition of bail, court order the defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit.

Defendant Willie James McElroy in court with attorney Joseph P Bastien.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 4, 5 and 6. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Willie James McElroy in court with attorney Joseph P Bastien.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for an initial appearance. Court cancels the stayed bench warrant. Defendant appears via zoom only. For reasons stated on the record, Court adjourns matter for defendant to appear in person.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Initial appearance scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Joseph P Bastien in court.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for an initial appearance.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Initial appearance scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
filed.

Defendant Willie James McElroy in court with attorney Joseph P Bastien.  Samuel Tufford appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Initial Appearance. All parties appeared via zoom. Defense counsel requests an adjournment, due to reasons put forth on the record. Case adjourned to Br 29. Defendant Willie James McElroy in court with attorney Joseph P Bastien.  Samuel Tufford appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Initial appearance scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
